AssertionConsumerService_Binding.info: Select the binding the SP claims support for. A binding specifies the technical method of a connection.

SingleLogoutService_Binding.info: *** SingleLogoutService is not supported by the Engine Block. Import for future compatibility. *** Selects the SingleLogoutService binding an SP claims support for. A binding specifies the protocol to access the service.

NameIDFormat.info: This indicates whether the nameID is set to something random or the same every time the user logs in. Use transient if user does not need to be identified in a new session.

certData.info: The supplied public certificate of the service. This must be a PEM encoded certificate. DER, CRT or CER are not supported.

certData2.info: Up to three certificates per service can be defined. This is the second field for certificates you can enter. This must be a PEM encoded certificate. DER, CRT or CER are not supported.

certData3.info: Up to three certificates per service can be defined. This is the third and last field for certificates you can enter. This must be a PEM encoded certificate. DER, CRT or CER are not supported.

SingleLogoutService_Binding.info: *** SingleLogoutService is not supported by the Engine Block. Import for future compatibility. *** Selects the SingleLogoutService binding an SP claims support for. A binding specifies the protocol to access the service.

SingleLogoutService_Location.info: *** SingleLogoutService is not supported by the Engine Block. Import for future compatibility. *** If the connected SP supports SAML 2.0 Single Logout, this will specify the endpoint element as a URL.

mdrpi:RegistrationInfo.info: The name of the authority that can register a service provider or identity provider.

logo:0:url.info: Enter the URL to the logo used for this service. e.g. https://static.example-logo.nl/media/sp/logo.png.

logo:0:width.info: The width of the logo found at logo:0:url in pixels.

logo:0:height.info: The height of the logo found at logo:0:url in pixels.

redirect.sign.info: Whether authentication request, logout requests and logout responses should be signed. The default is FALSE. This is generally set for trusted proxies like OpenID Connect Gateway or Stepup authentication gateway.

coin:sp_specific_metadata.info: Publish SP-specific metadata containing only whitelisted IdPs.

coin:publish_in_edugain.info: Set this for service providers that we publish in eduGAIN. When set, this entity also needs to have a value for coin:publish_in_edugain_date.

coin:publish_in_edugain_date.info: When this entity first appeared in the eduGAIN feed. Usually the current time.

coin:publish_in_edugain_allow_rns.info: Whether we have approved that this SP may use the Research & Scholarship entity category.

coin:imported_from_edugain.info: This is automatically set for service providers imported from eduGAIN. Unset it to prevent re-import.

coin:push_enabled.info: Must be set for this Service Provider to be included in the EB push despite being imported from eduGAIN.

coin:exclude_from_push.info: Must be set for this Service Provider to be excluded in the EB push.

coin:oidc_client.info: Set for those Service Providers that are OpenIDConnect clients.

coin:interfed_source.info: Must be set if the federation source is either eduGAIN or Entree.

coin:additional_logging.info: Set to get an extended form of logging.

coin:institution_id.info: The defined client code. Generally an abbreviation of the name of the client.

coin:institution_guid.info: This is a 128 bit number also known as a globally unique identifier (GUID or UUID) for this service.

coin:trusted_proxy.info: Set if the service provider can act on behalf of connected services to this service.

coin:no_consent_required.info: Select this option to skip the consent for a user.

coin:eula.info: The URL to the end-user license agreement (EULA) of the service provider.

coin:ss:idp_visible_only.info: Set to make invisible in the dashboard for institutions that are not connected to this service.

coin:ss:aansluitovereenkomst_refused.info: Set to indicate the service in the dashboard for institutions is marked as to have disagreed to sign the aansluitovereenkomst.

coin:ss:hidden.info: Set to make invisible in the dashboard for identity providers.

coin:application_url.info: The URL of the service used to log on.

coin:supports_idp_init_login.info: The service provider supports IDP initiated login.

coin:transparant_issuer.info: Set this to let the Engineblock use the EntityID of the IdP in stead of the EntityID of the Engineblock.

coin:do_not_add_attribute_aliases.info: Only send the SAML 2.0 name scheme.

coin:display_unconnected_idps_wayf.info: Display unconnected IdPs in the WAYF.

coin:policy_enforcement_decision_require.info: Set to activate the user policy engine (PDP).

coin:attribute_aggregation_required.info: Set to activate attribute aggregation for this service.

coin:original_metadata_url.info: The provided URL to the metadata of the service.

coin:original_metadata_certData.info: The signing certificate of the metadata of the service. This must be a PEM encoded certificate. DER, CRT or CER are not supported.

coin:service_team_id.info: Enter the team name as used in the SP Dashboard. e.g. urn:collab:group:example-teams.nl:nl:surfnet:services:spd_example.

coin:privacy:what_data.info: Explain in a sufficient level of detail what (types of) data, so not just attributes, are processed within the service.

coin:privacy:access_data.info: Explain what people or roles at which companies can access data, and if necessary to which extend.

coin:privacy:country.info: In what country or countries does the data reside; include both primary processing location(s) as well as for instance locations where backups live.

coin:privacy:security_measures.info: Explains what security measures are taken to protect data. You can also link to a page describing this.

coin:privacy:certification.info: Can a Third Party Memorandum (TPM) be supplied? e.g. ISO27001/2, ISAE3402, etc.

coin:privacy:certification_location.info: Where can customers find the mentioned certificates or how can they request access.

coin:privacy:certification_valid_from.info: The date from which the Third Party Memorandum (TPM) is valid.

coin:privacy:certification_valid_to.info: The date until the Third Party Memorandum (TPM) is valid.

coin:privacy:surfmarket_dpa_agreement.info: Has the service provider agreed a Data Processing Agreement (DPA) with SURFmarket?

coin:privacy:surfnet_dpa_agreement.info: Is the service provider willing to sign the SURF model Data Processing Agreement (DPA)?

coin:privacy:sn_dpa_why_not.info: Explains why the SP answered no on the subject of the SURFmarket DPA.

coin:privacy:privacy_policy.info: Does the SP publish an applicable privacy policy on a web page?

coin:privacy:privacy_policy_url.info: The URL to the applicable privacy policy.

coin:privacy:other_info.info: Other data privacy and security information that helps the institution decide whether it is OK to connect the service.

coin:signature_method.info: Select the Secure Hash Algorithm (SHA) to use for assertions sent by Engineblock to this service provider.

coin:sign_response.info: Set to also directly sign the SAML Response element, in addition to the Assertion element that will always be signed.

coin:privacy:gdpr_is_in_wiki.info: Set if the 'General Data Protection Regulation' (GDPR) is available on the SURF wiki. In Dutch known as 'Algemene Verordening Gegevensbescherming' (AVG).

coin:ss:license_status.info: Set the applicable license for this service as provisioned by the SP Dashboard.

^name:(en|nl|pt)$.info: Set the name of the service. Format: 'Service Name | Supplier'

^coin:ss:wiki_url:(en|nl)$.info: Add the URL to the SURF wiki for additional information of this service.

^coin:ss:type_of_service:(en|nl)$.info: The type of service used in the facet search in dashboard.

^AssertionConsumerService:([0-3]{0,1}[0-.info: An Assertion Consumer Service (or ACS) the location at a ServiceProvider that accepts <samlp:Response> messages. The type of binding for this location can be selected from the pull-down.

An Assertion Consumer Service (or ACS) is the location at a ServiceProvider that accepts <samlp:Response> messages. A typical ACS location for an SP might look like this: https://data.example-service.nl/saml/saml2_acs/

An Assertion Consumer Service (or ACS) is the location at a ServiceProvider that accepts <samlp:Response> messages. With the index you can include additional <md:AssertionConsumerService> elements in the SAML 2.0 SP metadata with the same binding, each with its own unique index.

^NameIDFormats:([0-2]{1})$.info: The NameIDFormat(s) this service provider supports. This can be transient, transparant or unspecified.

^contacts:([0-3]{1}):surName$.info: The surname of the contact. e.g. for 'John Doe', 'Doe' is the surname.

^contacts:([0-3]{1}):givenName$.info: The given name of the contact. e.g. for 'John Doe', 'John' is the given name.

^contacts:([0-3]{1}):emailAddress$.info: The e-mail address; syntax in accordance with RFC 5322. e.g. m.l.vermeegen@university.example.org.

^contacts:([0-3]{1}):telephoneNumber$.info: The telephone number of the contact.

^contacts:([0-3]{1}):isSirtfiSecurityCon.info: Set the security contact for this service.

^contacts:([0-3]{1}):contactType$.info: From the pull down, select the type of contact.

^OrganizationName:(en|nl)$.info: The formal name of the organization. e.g. Service by University of Harderwijk.

^OrganizationDisplayName:(en|nl)$.info: The friendly name of the organization. e.g. University of Harderwijk.

^OrganizationURL:(en|nl)$.info: The URL to the website of the service e.g. http://www.example-service.nl/en/.

^url:(en|nl)$.info: The URL to the support site of the service.

^mdui:PrivacyStatementURL:(en|nl)$.info: The URL to the Privacy Statement of the service.

^mdrpi:RegistrationPolicy:(en|nl)$.info: The URL to the Registration Policy of the service.

^coin:entity_categories:([1-4]{1})$.info: Select one of the entity categories applicable to this service. Entity Categories group federation entities that share common criteria.
